author: T.J. Muscaro
description: 'The Qataris and Egyptians, who have worked very hard to help bring Peace, will deliver this final proposal,' the U.S. president says.
title: Trump: Israel Agrees to 60-Day Gaza Cease-Fire

author: AAP
description: Strong winds and heavy rainfall have downed trees, damaged properties and flooded roads as a complex weather system lashed Australia’s east coast. About 200 properties in Burrill Lake on the NSW south coast were flooded overnight, the State Emergency Services said. Emergency crews responded to a surge in rescue incidents around Shoalhaven as flash flooding […]
title: Floods Hit 200 Properties Amid Wild Winds and Rain, 17,000 Without Power

author: The Canadian Press
description: The family of a Canadian tourist who was found dead in a northern part of the Dominican Republic is raising money to bring his remains home. Dorian Christian MacDonald, 33, was found dead in the water on a beach in the Puerto Plata resort town of Maimon Bay around 3 a.m. on June 20. Global […]
title: Family of NS Man Found Dead in Dominican Republic Asks Help to Bring Remains Home

author: The Canadian Press
description: Pierre Robitaille remembers feeling embarrassed in 1985 when he made his cellphone calls from a bulky device that came with its own carrying case. Now 86 years old, Robitaille was one of the first people in Canada to sign up for a wireless plan when they became available 40 years ago, on July 1, 1985. […]
title: From Bulky Car Phones to Pocket Computers, Cellphones Mark 40 Years in Canada

author: The Canadian Press
description: Jared Towers was in his research vessel on two separate occasions watching killer whales off the coast of Vancouver Island when the orcas dropped their prey directly in front of him and his colleagues. The encounters he describes as “rare” and awe-inspiring have led to a new study published in the peer-reviewed Journal of Comparative […]
title: Orcas Sharing Prey With Humans May Be Trying to Learn ‘Who We Are,’ Researcher Says

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: ‘Alligator Alcatraz,’ Extreme Heat in Europe, and Slavery Abolition Parade

author: Austin Alonzo
description: Negotiations continue in Washington as both sides work to prevent reciprocal tariffs from rising to 27 percent after a 90-day pause expires July 9.
title: Bessent: US, India Near Agreement to Lower Tariffs

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Novo Nordisk Canada has issued a voluntary recall for a batch of its Ozempic semaglutide injection pens because of potentially cracked glass cartridges. The nationwide medication recall from wholesalers and pharmacies is for a semaglutide solution in the 1.34 mg/mL size cartridge, according to a Health Canada advisory. The lot number of the recalled cartridges […]
title: Ozempic Pens Recalled in Canada Due to Damaged Cartridges

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Canadian identity and unity were the themes of the day as Prime Minister Mark Carney spoke to thousands of red and white clad festival-goers at Ottawa’s annual Canada Day celebrations. In his first Canada Day address as prime minister, Carney emphasized the need for Canadians to unite and focus on building a better and stronger […]
title: Carney Marks Canada Day With Speech About Unity and National Pride

author: Frank Fang
description: 'Thousands of North Korean cyber operatives have been trained and deployed by the regime to blend into the global digital workforce,' a U.S. attorney says.
title: DOJ Announces Indictments in Takedown of North Korean Remote Worker Operation

author: Lee Hall
description: NTD’s Lee Hall sits down with Alka Sehgal Cuthbert, the director of Don’t Divide Us, to talk about the Equality Act. Sehgal Cuthbert says this law is breaking down Britain’s workplace civility and creating a grievance culture, resulting in a big rise in tribunals—most of which are rejected. She says the Act is used to […]
title: The Equality Act Is Damaging Our Culture and Is Not Fit for Purpose: Alka Sehgal Cuthbert

author: Sean Tseng
description: Kabul scrapped a $540 million oil pact after China failed to invest, spotlighting the limits of Beijing’s big-money promises in unstable Afghanistan.
title: Taliban’s Oil Deal Divorce With China Tests Beijing’s Checkbook Diplomacy: Analysts

author: Michael Wing
description: The City of Calgary is reintroducing fluoride back into its drinking water, saying it helps prevent tooth decay. The city had removed the mineral from its water system in 2011. Effective June 30, fluoride levels will be maintained at “optimal” concentrations of 0.7 milligrams per litre, according to Health Canada‘s guidelines, the city says on […]
title: Calgary Brings Fluoride Back to Its Drinking Water System After 14 Years of Defluoridation

author: Naveen Athrappully
description: Ensuring a robust rare earth supply chain is critical to many sectors of modern society.
title: Indian Company Looking to Mine Rare Earths in 3–4 Years, CEO Says

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Ministers say adults who exploit children will no longer rely on perceived consent as a defence.
title: Sex Crime Law Overhaul to Mandate Rape Charges for Adults Who Abuse Children Under 16

author: Rachel Roberts
description: Three people who were part of the senior leadership team at the Countess of Chester Hospital where convicted nurse worked from 2015-16 were arrested on Monday.
title: Manslaughter Arrests of Hospital Bosses Involved in Lucy Letby Baby Deaths

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Scammers are using artificial intelligence to impersonate government officials and prominent public figures to steal money and information from Canadians, security officials say. The Canadian Anti-Fraud Centre and the Canadian Centre for Cyber Security have issued a joint advisory warning of a “spike in malicious cyber activity” involving scammers who use text messages and AI-generated […]
title: Scammers Impersonating High-Ranking Officials, Executives to Steal Money, Information: Canadian Cyber Security Officials

author: Bill Pan
description: Taiwanese officials expect the Chinese regime to use a range of so-called gray zone tactics before a full-scale invasion.
title: Taiwan to Double Length of Annual Military Drill, Focus on CCP Invasion

author: Guy Birchall
description: The move comes as the liberal coalition government in Warsaw received criticism from its conservative opposition over illegal immigration.
title: Poland to Bring in Tighter Controls Along German and Lithuanian Borders

author: Carolina Avendano
description: Explainer Hikvision, the Chinese company that was ordered by Ottawa to shut down Canadian operations last week, has been mired in a number of security issues for years. The company’s products have been banned by the U.S. Federal Communications Commission for posing an “unacceptable risk” to national security and the security and safety of Americans. […]
title: Why Canada Ordered Chinese Surveillance Company Hikvision to Shut Down Operations

author: John Robson
description: Commentary So now we have a number. After sliding along for years pretending we meant to hit NATO’s 2 percent of GDP defence target, or quietly admitting we didn’t, we suddenly promised to. Then the target was raised to 5 percent and the prime minister didn’t blink even though it will cost $150 billion a […]
title: John Robson: Government Must Make Major Cuts to Fund $150B Defence Plan

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Ottawa has eliminated all interprovincial trade barriers that fall under its jurisdiction, Internal Trade Minister Chrystia Freeland has announced. The federal government is removing all of the remaining federal exceptions from the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) that had been inhibiting free trade between the provinces, Freeland said in a June 30 press release. The […]
title: Ottawa Removes All Federal Exceptions in Canada ​​Trade Pact for Smoother Interprovincial Trade

author: Owen Evans
description: Company to gain foothold in Europe as the West tries cut China out of the ion battery supply chain.
title: US Battery Startup Lyten to Take Over Northvolt Factory in Poland

author: Adam Morrow
description: The arrests come shortly after several Azerbaijanis were arrested in Russia’s south-central city of Yekaterinburg.
title: Azerbaijan Arrests Russian Journalists in Baku Amid Escalating Diplomatic Row

author: Melanie Sun
description: 'The steel was cut down in size and used in a way that did not comply with regulations,' Paetongtarn Shinawatra said.
title: Design, Construction Flaws Led to Bangkok Building Collapse: PM

author: Guy Birchall
description: Warnings were in place across the continent, with Spain experiencing its hottest June on record.
title: Heat Wave Hits Europe as Wildfires Break Out in France, Turkey

author: The Associated Press
description: Severe thunderstorms on Monday set off a mudslide, leaving homes covered with water and debris.
title: Dozens Evacuated From Austrian Village After Mudslide Covers Parts of Alpine Valley

author: The Associated Press
description: The hurricane center said Flossie became a Category 1 hurricane Monday night.
title: Hurricane Flossie Strengthens Further Off Mexico’s Pacific Coast

author: Chris Summers
description: Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra was suspended following a leaked telephone call with Cambodia's former leader, Hun Sen.
title: Thai Prime Minister Suspended by Court After Cambodia Phone Call Leaked

author: Reuters
description: SEOUL—Former South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol on Tuesday risked another attempt at arresting him by skipping questioning by a special prosecutor investigating his December declaration of martial law, prompting the prosecutor to issue a new summons for Saturday. Yoon said he did not go to Tuesday’s appointment because he needed to prepare for a […]
title: South Korea’s Former President Yoon Defies Summons in Martial Law Probe

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: In a landmark case which pitted Australia's tough anti-hate-speech laws against freedom of religion, the court has muzzled the mullah.
title: Court Finds Islamic Preacher Breached Racism Laws With Anti-Jewish Sermons

author: AAP
description: Millennials beware: Australian avocado production has taken a dip. Australia’s avocado crop is estimated to be down 15 per cent in the 2024-25 season compared to the previous year, according to a global report by Rabobank. The culprit is alternate bearing, in which trees can produce a lot of fruit one year followed by very little […]
title: Avo Production Smashed, but Still 20 for Every Aussie

author: Aldgra Fredly
description: The U.S. president directs his administration to end economic practices that ‘disproportionately benefit’ Cuba's communist regime and its military.
title: Trump Signs Memo Strengthening US Policy Toward Cuba

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: The recall affects the supermarket chain's 1-kilogram jars of smooth and crunchy peanut butter.
title: Coles Peanut Butter Urgently Recalled After Toxin Discovered

author: Alfred Bui
description: Further investigations into more allegations are still ongoing.
title: Victorian Childcare Worker Charged with 70 Child Sex Offences

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: An inaugural liquefied natural gas (LNG) cargo left the new LNG Canada facility in Kitimat, B.C., on June 30, marking the first-ever large scale LNG shipment from Canada’s West coast to Asian markets. The 291-metre long and 46-metre wide GasLog Glasgow tanker chartered by Shell and operating under Bermuda’s flag left the Kitimat terminal with […]
title: First Shipment of LNG Canada Leaves BC Terminal for Asia

author: Alfred Bui
description: A leaked CCP directive reveals efforts to dismantle groups linked to Falun Gong, but in Australia, families are speaking out.
title: Beijing’s Long Arm Reaches Australian Homes, But Migrant Parents Aren’t Staying Silent

author: Carolina Avendano
description: Flights at Vancouver International Airport have returned to schedule after a weekend of more than 200 delays caused by staffing shortages at Canada’s air traffic control agency. The Vancouver International Airport (YVR) recorded 219 flight delays and 23 cancellations over the weekend due to staffing shortages at Nav Canada, YVR spokesperson Reena Gacad Kirkpatrick told […]
title: Flights Resume on Schedule at Vancouver Airport After Over 200 Canada Day Long Weekend Delays

author: Ryan Morgan
description: Following years of concerns about Tehran's true motives, Israeli and U.S. military strikes dealt significant blows to the Iranian nuclear program.
title: Infographic: Inside the Secret Mission That Took Down Iran’s Nuclear Plants
